sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods: 

3x + 5y = 19 

2x - 4y = -10
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods, we'll first write the given system in matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the column matrix of constants.

A = | 3  5 |, X = | x |, B = | 19  |
    | 2 -4 |      | y |      |-10  |

Now, we'll find the inverse of matrix A (A_inv) and multiply it with matrix B to get the matrix X.

A_inv = 1/det(A) * adj(A)

First, we'll find the determinant of A (det(A)):

det(A) = (3 * -4) - (5 * 2) = -12 - 10 = -22

Now, we'll find the adjoint of A (adj(A)):

adj(A) = | -4 -5 |
         | -2  3 |

Now, we'll find the inverse of A (A_inv):

A_inv = 1/det(A) * adj(A) = -1/22 * | -4 -5 |
                                    | -2  3 |

A_inv = | 2/11   5/22 |
        | 1/11  -3/22 |

Now, we'll multiply A_inv with B to get X:

X = A_inv * B = | 2/11   5/22 | * | 19  |
                | 1/11  -3/22 |   |-10  |

X = | (2/11 * 19) + (5/22 * -10) |
     | (1/11 * 19) + (-3/22 * -10) |

X = | 38/11 - 50/22 |
     | 19/11 + 30/22 |

X = | 26/11 |
     | 49/22 |

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 26/11 and y = 49/22.
